author: Lee Tolliver
title: 2014 All-Tidewater | Girls basketball
text:
ALL-TIDEWATER PLAYER OF THE YEAR
GADIVA HUBBARD
Princess Anne, 5-7 sophomore guard
Averaged 18.6 points, 7.1 rebounds and had 97 steals Led the Cavaliers to the Group 5A state title, scoring 35 points and making seven 3-pointers in the final Conference 9 Player of the Year and first-team All-Group 5A South Region Read more about Hubbard
FIRST TEAM
KHADEDRA CROKER
King’s Fork, 6-3 senior center
Averaged 19.9 points, 15.5 rebounds and 8 blocks, while recording 25 double-doubles and 15 triple-doubles. Finished career with more than 1,000 points, 1,000 rebounds and 956 blocks Conference 18 Player of the Year, first-team All-Group 4A South Region Committed to Virginia Tech ____
CHANETTE HICKS
Maury, 5-6 junior guard
Averaged 11.6 points, 7.2 rebounds, 9.4 assists and 6.1 steals All-Conference 9 Defensive Player of the Year, first-team All-Group 5A South Region Committed to Virginia Tech ____
LA'DEJA JAMES
First Colonial, 5-9 junior guard
Averaged 18.2 points, 6.1 rebounds and 2.7 steals, while shooting 81 percent from the free-throw line First-team All-Conference 1, first-team All-Group 6A South Region ____
ENDIA McKINNEY
Lake Taylor, 5-10 senior forward
Averaged 12 points and 12 rebounds Led the Titans to the Group 4A state title First-team All-Conference 17, first-team All-Group 4A South Region ____
SHRITA PARKER
Ocean Lakes, 5-7 senior guard
Averaged a South Hampton Roads public school-best 25.1 points and 5 rebounds and finished with 1,868 career points First-team All-Conference 1, first-team All-Group 6A South Region Committed to Rutgers
SECOND TEAM
TOMMARAH HARRIS
Wilson, 5-10 senior guard
Averaged 15.5 points, 4.1 rebounds, 3.3 assists and 2.8 steals Conference 17 Player of the Year and first-team All-4A South Region ____
ALEXIS McKAY
Western Branch, 5-10 senior forward
Averaged 14.8 points and 12 rebounds and recorded 57 assists, 31 steals, 48 three-pointers and 14 double-doubles Conference 2 Player of the Year, second-team All-Group 6A South Region ____
TAKERRA PARSONS
Bayside, 5-8 junior guard
Averaged 17.3 points and 9.1 rebounds, and had 68 steals and 61 blocks First-team All-Conference 1 ____
BIANCA ROACH
Cape Henry, 5-7 senior guard
Averaged 27 points and finished career as Cape Henry’s all-time leading scorer with 1,738 points Tidewater Conference Player of the Year, first-team All-VISAA Committed to the Naval Academy ____
JANAYLA WHITE
Princess Anne, 6-2 senior center
Averaged 11 points, 10.8 rebounds, 4 blocks and 4.5 steals First-team All-Conference 9, second-team All-Group 5A South Committed to Radford ____
Looking for more? See our picks for the third and fourth teams .
